project.name: Documentation
project.description: The Gentoo Documentation Project is the official Gentoo project devoted to the complete and concise documentation of the Gentoo Project.

p.b: What we do, and who we are

longdescription.p: The Gentoo Documentation Project (GDP) is the official project of the Gentoo project responsible for the creation and maintenance of all official Gentoo documentation. The GDP is not a closed team of any sorts, but instead an open community commited to critiqing, and possibly integrating, viable user documentation.

The Gentoo Documentation Project was formed to address the need of complete documentation for Gentoo. In doing so, the GDP team is commited to the creation and maintenance of clear, concise, and original documentation. We will protect our users and developers by the use of free and open licensing on all documentation. The GDP is commited to remaining a free and open project, and will abide by the Social Contract set forth by the Gentoo Project.

project.extraproject: This project develops a Gentoo Handbook.

body.p: The Gentoo Documentation Project makes intensive use of the gentoo-doc@gentoo.org mailinglist. On this mailinglist discussions about documentation, subprojects, translations and more pass by.

To subscribe to this mailinglist, send an empty e-mail to gentoo-doc-subscribe@gentoo.org. Once subscribed you can post to it by sending an e-mail to gentoo-doc@gentoo.org. To unsubscribe from the list, send an empty e-mail to gentoo-doc-unsubscribe@gentoo.org. There is also an online archive on news.gmane.org.

To participate in the Gentoo Documentation Project first join the mailing list at gentoo-doc@gentoo.org. Then ask if there are plans to support something that you are interested in, propose a new subproject that you are interested in, or choose one of the planned subprojects to work on. You may talk to the developers and users in the IRC channel #gentoo-doc on irc.freenode.net for more information or just to chat about the project or any subprojects. If you don't have the ability to actively help by contributing work we will always need editors to maintain the quality and accuracy of the overall product. All development, editing, and productive comments and feedback will be greatly appreciated.
